column4: Ok, I've read and tried every tip with Samba and it still will not work out for me.  I can see the windows computer but the windows computer cannot see the ubuntu machine.

my 'basics samba setup' - Install samba service/pckage, edit smb.conf enable home shares, set them to be 'broweable'   - give each user a samba password with 'sudo smbpasswd -a USERNAME'  - and be sure the workgroup name is correct in the smb.conf.. thats about it for me.
unetbootin has had issues in the past.. I tend to use tools from the Pendrivelinux web site.
thanks, I'll check that out as well!
and from what i gather of his issue.. unetbootin is not the answer.. but ive just been skimming the  channel. :)
